intro: Ipomopsis spicata subsp. spicata, commonly known as the spicata ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
